name: PappaRich

Finally I found one of the authentic Penang Char Kway Teow.

We tried out the new bamboo rice. The rice was pretty fragrance. Their muttons can be softer/ more tender though. Nonetheless,
they have several meat choices which maybe better.

We never got tired of PapaRich. They have been around for many years, it's reliable.

Affordable fare, dishes competently done though not spectacular. Had the wat tan hor fun, and white coffee. Nice place to sit and catch up with friends, great to have a halal certified eatery for meet-up. Service is brisk, though the staff appeared really busy, managing best as they can, without establishing any eye contact.

First time here, we‚Äôre looking for halal establishments. We found this place. The waiting time was okay considering dinner time. Good selection and great tasty food from Nasi lemak ayam Rendang their favourites, prawn Mee soup, Curry noodles, and many more. Reasonable priced.
Fresh and flavourful food at reasonable prices. The Chendol was the showstopper ‚ù§Ô∏è. The restaurant will be relocating to the other side of the mall soon at 01-35
